Package ohos.agp.components

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ComponentContainer, Image, IndexBar, PageSliderIndicator, ProgressBar, SurfaceProvider, Text, TextureComponentEx, WebView

    public class Component
extends Object
    Provides basic components for a user interface (UI).

    Each component occupies a rectangular area on the screen and is responsible for drawing and event processing in this area. Component is the base class for controls, which are used to create interactive UI components. Its child class ComponentContainer is the base class for all layouts, which defines layout properties for other components or component groups.

    Since:
    3

      Indicates the vertical orientation mode.
      static int VISIBLE
      The component is visible.

      • startDragAndDrop

        public final boolean startDragAndDrop​(MimeData data,
                                      Component.DragFeedbackProvider shadowProvider)
        Starts dragging a component.

        There is one way to turn on dragging. LongClickedListener need to be set for this component. After LongClickedListener listener is invoked before TouchEvent#PRIMARY_POINT_UP, component is ready for DragAndDrop. startDragAndDrop need to be invoked in LongClickedListener#onLongClicked callback with created DragFeedbackProvider and shadowView.

        Parameters:
        data - Indicates the data carried by the dragged component.
        shadowProvider - Indicates the provider of the dragged component's style.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the component is ready for dragging; returns false otherwise.

      • getComponentParent

        public final ComponentParent getComponentParent​()
        Obtains the parent layout of a component.

        Each component must be within a parent layout, or itself must be a root component (or layout).

        Returns:
        Returns the parent layout of the component; returns an empty string if the component itself is a root component (or layout).

      • addDrawTask

        public void addDrawTask​(Component.DrawTask task)
        Adds a drawing task between the foreground and the component content.

        This method invokes addDrawTask(ohos.agp.components.Component.DrawTask,int), where the value of layer is DrawTask#BETWEEN_CONTENT_AND_FOREGROUND.

        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the drawing task to add.
        See Also:
        addDrawTask(DrawTask, int), invalidate()

      • addDrawTask

        public void addDrawTask​(Component.DrawTask task,
                        int layer)
        Adds a draw task.

        The drawing of each component includes its foreground, content, and background.You can use this method to add a drawing task between the foreground and the content or between the content and the background.

        Parameters:
        task - Indicates the drawing task to add.
        layer - Indicates the position of the drawing task. This value can only be DrawTask#BETWEEN_BACKGROUND_AND_CONTENT or DrawTask#BETWEEN_CONTENT_AND_FOREGROUND.

      • invalidate

        public void invalidate​()
        Invalidates a component.

        This method is mainly used to update a component's drawing tasks. Modifying component attributes will automatically trigger a component update.

        Parameters:

        public boolean getContentEnable​()
        Obtains whether the content of the component will be drawn.
        Returns:

      • createAnimatorProperty

        public AnimatorProperty createAnimatorProperty​()
        Creates a property animator object associated with a component.

        When you use this method to create an animator object, the current component is automatically set as the target of the animator. The animator only changes the display of the component and the event capturing area. It does not change the layout of the component.

        Returns:
        Returns a new property animator object associated with the current component.
        Since:
        3

      • setContentPosition

        public void setContentPosition​(float x,
                               float y)
        Sets positions for drawing and event listening.

        The position of each component relative to the parent layout is indicated using the position of its upper-left corner. This method is used to change the position of a component in the parent layout, as well as the area where the component listens for screen events. This method does not change the layout. It should be used mainly for animation.

        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the new X-axis coordinate, in unit of pixels.
        y - Indicates the new Y-axis coordinate, in unit of pixels.

      • setContentPositionX

        public void setContentPositionX​(float x)
        Sets the x-coordinate for drawing and event listening.

        You can use this method to:

        • Change the position of a component in the parent layout. Each component takes its upper left corner as its position relative to the parent layout.
        • Listen for screen events.

        Calling this method does not change the layout. It should be used mainly for animations.

        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the x-coordinate to set, in pixels.
        Since:
        4

      • setContentPositionY

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth​()
        Obtains the width of a component.

        This method obtains the actual width of the component if it is already bound to a window. Formula: Width = Location of the right edge - Location of the left edge. If the component is not bound to a window, this method returns its width recorded in LayoutConfig.

        Returns:
        Returns the width of the component, in unit of pixels.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight​(int height)
        Sets the height of a component.

        This method modifies the height in the LayoutConfig object associated with the component. The actual effect varies depending on the parent layout type.

        Parameters:
        height - Indicates the height of the component, in unit of pixels. A value less than 0 means that the component will not be displayed.

      • setRotationSensitivity

        public void setRotationSensitivity​(float value)
        Sets the rotation sensitivity of a component. Each component that supports the rotating crown provides a suitable sensitivity range between ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW and ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH. The rotation sensitivity of ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT is set by default for each component. You can also adjust the rotation sensitivity appropriately.
        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the rotation sensitivity of the component.
        Since:
        3

      • getRotationSensitivity

        public float getRotationSensitivity​()
        Obtains the rotation sensitivity of a component.
        Returns:
        Returns the rotation sensitivity of the component.
        Since:
        3

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight​()
        Obtains the height of a component.

        This method obtains the actual height of the component if it is already bound to a window. Formula: Height = Location of the top edge - Location of the bottom edge. If the component is not bound to a window, this method returns its height recorded in LayoutConfig.

        Returns:
        Returns the height of the component, in unit of pixels.

        Obtains the top edge position of a component relative to the parent layout.

        This value is the top edge position of the actual layout. It is different from the top edge of the component's displayed area.

        Returns:
        Returns the top edge's relative position, in pixels.

      • setTop

        public void setTop​(int top)
        Sets the top edge position of a component relative to the parent container.

        This method can be used only by the layout system. We can't use it generally because the property value can be changed at any time by the parent container.*

        Parameters:
        top - Indicates the top edge's relative position, in pixels.

      • getBottom

        Returns:
        Returns the bottom edge's relative position, in pixels.

      • setComponentPosition

        public void setComponentPosition​(int left,
                                 int top,
                                 int right,
                                 int bottom)
        Sets the component's position relative to the parent container.

        This method can be used only by the layout system. We can't use it generally because the property values can be changed at any time by the parent container.

        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the position of the component's left edge, in pixels.
        top - Indicates the position of the component's top edge, in pixels.
        right - Indicates the position of the component's right edge, in pixels.
        bottom - Indicates the position of the component's bottom edge, in pixels.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the width (right - left) or height (bottom - top) value is less than 0.

        4

      • setLayoutConfig

        public void setLayoutConfig​(ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig config)
        Sets the layout parameters of a component in its parent layout.

        The child class of layout parameters passed in varies depending on the child class of the parent layout. After the component tree that contains the current component is added to a window, the system calculates the position, width, and height of the component in the parent layout based on the ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig parameters and type of the component. The following child classes of layout parameters are supported:

        • StackLayout.LayoutConfig
        • DirectionalLayout.LayoutConfig
        • DependentLayout.LayoutConfig
        • TableLayout.LayoutConfig
        • ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig
        Parameters:
        config - Indicates the layout parameters of the component. These parameters cannot be null.

      • getLayoutConfig

        public ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig getLayoutConfig​()
        Obtains the layout parameters associated with a component.

        All components should have layout parameters. They supply parameters to the parent layout of a component specify how the component should be arranged. There are many child classes of ComponentContainer.LayoutConfig, which correspond to different child classes of ComponentContainer that are responsible for arranging their children. If the component is not bound to a parent ComponentContainer or an exception occurs when calling the component is bound to a parent ComponentContainer, this method must not return null.

        Returns:
        Returns the layout parameters associated with the component; returns null if the component is not bound to a parent ComponentContainer or an exception occurs when calling

      • setVisibility

        public void setVisibility​(int visibility)
        Sets the visibility of a component.

        When the parameter value is VISIBLE, the component occupies space and needs to be rendered. When the parameter value is INVISIBLE, the component occupies space but does not need to be rendered. When the parameter value is HIDE, the component occupies no space and does not need to be rendered.

        Parameters:
        visibility - The value is one of the following: VISIBLE, INVISIBLE, or HIDE.

      • getVisibility

        public int getVisibility​()
        Obtains the visibility of a component.

        A component can have three visibility states:

        • VISIBLE: The component occupies space and needs to be rendered.
        • INVISIBLE: The component occupies space but does not need to be rendered.
        • HIDE: The component occupies no space and does not need to be rendered.
        Returns:
        Returns the visibility state of the component. The value can be one of the following: VISIBLE, INVISIBLE, or HIDE.
        See Also:
        setVisibility(int visibility)

      • notifyAccessibility

        public void notifyAccessibility​(int eventType)
        Triggers an accessibility event specified by this component.
        Parameters:
        eventType - Indicates the accessibility event to trigger. The value can be any of the following:
        • 0x00000001: A component such as a button is clicked.
        • 0x00000002: A component is long pressed.
        • 0x00000004: A component is selected.
        • 0x00000008: A component is in focus.
        • 0x00000010: A text is changed.
        • 0x00000020: The content of a window is changed.
        • 0x00001000: A component stops scrolling.
        • 0x00004000: The content of a component is read.
        • 0x00008000: The accessibility focus is obtained.
        • 0x00010000: The accessibility focus is cleared.
        • 0x01000000: A component starts scrolling.
        Since:
        4

      • isBoundToWindow

        public boolean isBoundToWindow​()
        Checks whether the component has been bound to a window.

        Each window creates a component tree. Each component that needs to be displayed in the window must be bound to this tree.Adding a component to the component tree is equivalent to binding a component to a window.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the component has been bound to a window; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isComponentDisplayed

        public boolean isComponentDisplayed​()
        Checks whether the component can be displayed.

        This is different from the visibility of the component. For example, for a component whose visibility state is VISIBLE, if its size is 0 or if its parent layout cannot be displayed, the component still cannot be displayed on the screen. On the contrary, even for a component that is completely transparent, this method returns true if the component can be displayed on the screen simply by changing its transparency color.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the component can be displayed; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setDraggedListener

        public void setDraggedListener​(int dragMode,
                               Component.DraggedListener listener)
        Registers a listener for drag events of a component.

        All registered observers will be notified of drag events dispatched to this component. If listener is null, drag events will be canceled. One component can own several identical drag recognizers, and the user-defined drag recognizer takes precedence over the internal drag recognizer.

        Parameters:
        dragMode - Indicates the current drag mode. The value can be one of the following: DRAG_HORIZONTAL_VERTICAL, DRAG_HORIZONTAL, DRAG_VERTICAL
        listener - Indicates the listener for drag events.
        Since:
        3

      • getDraggedListener

        public Component.DraggedListener getDraggedListener​()
        Obtains a listener for monitoring drag events of this component.
        Returns:
        Returns the listener.
        Since:
        4

      • setDragAcceptAngle

        public void setDragAcceptAngle​(float degree)
        Sets the deflection angle for a horizontal or vertical drag recognizer.

        The deflection angle refers to the included angle between the dragging direction and the principal direction, which is horizontal regarding a horizontal drag recognizer or vertical regarding a vertical drag recognizer. If the dragging displacement on the touchscreen projected onto the principal direction exceeds the preset threshold (8 vp) but is less than twice the threshold, the drag recognizer calculates the deflection angle and assumes that dragging starts only when the calculated angle is less than the one you set via this method. If the dragging displacement exceeds twice the threshold, the drag recognizer assumes that dragging starts, regardless of the deflection angle you set. This method takes effect only on a drag recognizer whose dragMode is set to DRAG_HORIZONTAL or DRAG_VERTICAL via setDraggedListener(int, ohos.agp.components.Component.DraggedListener). The default deflection angle is 26.57 degrees.

        Parameters:
        degree - Indicates the deflection angle to set. The value ranges from 15.0 to 75.0 degrees.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        getDragAcceptAngle(), setDraggedListener(int dragMode, DraggedListener listener)

      • getDragAcceptAngle

        public float getDragAcceptAngle​()
        Obtains the deflection angle set for a horizontal or vertical drag recognizer.
        Returns:
        Returns the deflection angle, in degrees.
        Since:
        5
        See Also:
        setDragAcceptAngle(float degree)

      • onDrag

        public boolean onDrag​(Component component,
                      DragEvent event)
        Called when a drag event is dispatched to the component.

        There are two different types of scenarios: 

         Scenario 1: If the drag event is broadcast, the drag event listener is notified as long as the component's
 DraggedListener is not empty.
 Scenario 2: If the drag event is not broadcast, the drag event listener of the specified component is
 called back as long as its DraggedListener is not empty. If the event is not processed and the event
 type is DragEvent#DRAG_DROP, the DraggedListener of the parent layout is called to process
 the event.
        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the component.
        event - Indicates the drag event.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the drag event is processed correctly; returns false otherwise.

      • simulateClick

        public boolean simulateClick​()
        Performs a click event in a component.

        This method calls the OnClickListener created for the component. The observer registered by the setClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.ClickedListener) method will be notified. After the callback is executed, the system passes a lifting event to the click event listener.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback function is executed successfully.
        Since:
        4

      • performScale

        public boolean performScale​()
        Performs a scale event in a component.

        This method invokes the callback for scale events of the control. Observers registered by the setScaledListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.ScaledListener) method will be notified. When the callback is executed, the system will transfer the scale event to the scale listener.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback function is executed successfully.

      • simulateDrag

        public boolean simulateDrag​()
        Performs a drag event of a component.

        This method invokes the callback for drag events of the control. Observers registered by the setDraggedListener(int,ohos.agp.components.Component.DraggedListener) method will be notified. When the callback is executed, the system will transfer the drag event to the drag listener.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback function is executed successfully.
        Since:
        4

      • callOnClick

        public boolean callOnClick​()
        Calls the assigned OnClickListener.

        Unlike simulateClick(), this method only notifies observers registered using the setClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.ClickedListener) method, but does not perform any actual operation on the component itself.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the assigned OnClickListener is called successfully.

      • executeLongClick

        public boolean executeLongClick​()
        Performs a long-click event in a component.

        This method calls the OnLongClickListener created for the component. Observers registered by the setLongClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.LongClickedListener) method will be notified. After the callback is executed, the system passes a lifting event to the long-click event listener.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the callback function is executed successfully.
        Since:
        4

      • executeDoubleClick

        public boolean executeDoubleClick​()
        Executes the double-click event occurring in this component.

        This method calls the OnDoubleClickListener created for this component. Observers registered by the setDoubleClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.DoubleClickedListener) method will be notified. After the callback is invoked, the system passes an event indicating the end of a double-click event to the listener set by setDoubleClickedListener(ohos.agp.components.Component.DoubleClickedListener).

        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • setClickable

        public void setClickable​(boolean clickable)
        Enables or disables click events for the component.

        If a component is clickable, its state will change to pressed upon every click. Child classes should set the component to clickable to visually react to user clicks. If a component is not clickable, it should not be able to receive focus. If it has already received focus, the focus should be cleared immediately.

        Parameters:
        clickable - true means to make the component clickable, and false means the opposite.
        See Also:
        isClickable()

      • isClickable

        public boolean isClickable​()
        Returns whether the component responds to click events or not.

        If a component is not clickable, it cannot receive focus.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the component is clickable; returns false if it is not.
        See Also:
        setClickable(boolean)

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Sets the enabled state of the component.

        The interpretation of the enabled state varies depending on the child class. If a component is not enabled, it should not acquire focus.

        Parameters:
        enabled - true means the component is enabled, and false means the opposite.

      • setClipEnabled

        public void setClipEnabled​(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether to allow automatic clipping of the component in case it exceeds its parent layout.
        Parameters:
        enabled - true means to allow auto-clipping, and false means the opposite.

      • getClipEnabled

        public boolean getClipEnabled​()
        Checks whether automatic clipping of this component is enabled when it exceeds its parent layout.
        Returns:
        Returns true if automatic clipping is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled​()
        Obtains the enabled state of the component. The default state is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the component is enabled; returns false if it is not.

      • setFocusable

        public void setFocusable​(int focusable)
        Sets whether the component can receive focus.

        The value FOCUS_ENABLE means the component can receive focus. The value FOCUS_ADAPTABLE means to let the framework to determine whether the component can receive focus based on the component's interactivity. This is the default value. The value FOCUS_DISABLE ensures that the component is also not focusable in touch mode. Each component uses a state bit to indicate whether it is focusable. If a component is not clickable, this state bit cannot be changed to indicate focusable.

        Parameters:
        focusable - Indicates whether the component can gain focus. The value can be FOCUS_DISABLE, FOCUS_ENABLE, or FOCUS_ADAPTABLE.

      • setTouchFocusable

        public void setTouchFocusable​(boolean focusable)
        Sets whether the component can receive focus while in touch mode.

        Setting this to true will also ensure that the component is focusable.

        Parameters:
        focusable - Indicates whether the component can receive focus.
        Since:
        4

      • getFocusable

        public int getFocusable​()
        Obtains the focusable setting of the component.

        The return value is the same as the value set by the setFocusable(int) method.

        Returns:
        Returns the focusable setting of the component. The value can be any of the following: FOCUS_DISABLE, FOCUS_ENABLE, or FOCUS_ADAPTABLE.

      • setId

        public void setId​(int id)
        Sets the unique ID of the component.

        The component ID is usually a non-negative value, and is set to -1 by default.

        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the component ID to set.

      • getId

        public int getId​()
        Obtains the unique ID of the component.

        The default value is -1.

        Returns:
        Returns the component ID.

      • setName

        public void setName​(String name)

        The component name is usually a string, and is set to empty by default.

        Parameters:
        name - Indicates the component name to set.

      • getName

        public String getName​()
        Obtains the name of the component.

        The default name is empty.

        Returns:
        Returns the component name.

      • setLongClickable

        public void setLongClickable​(boolean longClickable)
        Sets whether the component is long clickable.

        Parameters:
        longClickable - Indicates whether the component is long clickable.
        See Also:
        isLongClickOn()

      • isLongClickOn

      • setSelected

        public void setSelected​(boolean selected)
        Sets the selection state of the component.

        A component can be selected or deselected. Note that being selected is not the same as in focus. components are typically selected in the context of an AdapterView like ListContainer; a selected component is highlighted.

        Parameters:

      • requestFocus

        public boolean requestFocus​()
        Requests focus for the current component or one of its child components.

        A component will not be able to actually take focus in any of the following situations: the component is not focusable (isFocusable() returns false); or the component is not focusable in touch mode (isTouchFocusable() returns false); or the component is invisible, disabled, or has not acquired space for drawing.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the component or one of its child components has taken focus; returns false otherwise.

      • setBindStateChangedListener

        public void setBindStateChangedListener​(Component.BindStateChangedListener listener)
        Adds a listener for bind state changes.

        To display a component on the screen, you must add it to the component tree of a window. Each component has a listener list that has implemented the BindStateChangedListener interface. When a component is bound to or unbound from a window, the BindStateChangedListener#onComponentBoundToWindow(Component) and BindStateChangedListener#onComponentUnboundFromWindow(Component) methods of this interface are called back, respectively. This method adds listeners specified by the input parameter to the listener list.

        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to add.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        removeBindStateChangedListener(BindStateChangedListener)

      • removeBindStateChangedListener

        public void removeBindStateChangedListener​(Component.BindStateChangedListener listener)
        Removes a listener for bind state changes.

        To display a component on the screen, you must add it to the component tree of a window. Each component has a listener list that has implemented the BindStateChangedListener interface. When a component is bound to or unbound from a window, the BindStateChangedListener#onComponentBoundToWindow(Component) (Component)} and BindStateChangedListener#onComponentUnboundFromWindow(Component) methods of this interface are called back, respectively. This method removes listeners specified by the input parameter from the listener list.

        Parameters:
        listener - Indicates the listener to remove.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        setBindStateChangedListener(BindStateChangedListener)

        public void setFocusBorderRadius​(float radius)
        Sets the radius for the focus border.

        The focus border is displayed only when the component is in focus and the focus border is enabled.

        Parameters:
        radius - Indicates the radius to set. This value must be greater than 0, and in this case the focus border is a rounded rectangle or a circle.
        Since:
        4

      • setFocusBorderRadius

        public void setFocusBorderRadius​(float[] radii)
        Sets the radii for corners of the focus border.

        The focus border is displayed only when the component is in focus and the focus border is enabled.

        Parameters:
        radii - Indicates an array containing radii of the focus border's four corners. The setting is valid only if the array length is 8. Each pair of values represents a corner's x-axis radius and the y-axis radius, respectively.
        Since:
        4

      • findComponentById

        public Component findComponentById​(int id)

      • findFocus

        public Component findFocus​()
        Obtains the component that currently has focus among its descendant components and itself.

        If the component is a simple component and currently has focus, the component is returned. Otherwise, null is returned. If the component has descendants and one of the descendants has focus, the focused descendant is returned. If no descendant has focus, null is returned.

        Returns:
        Returns the focused component; or null if no focused component can be found.

      • findNextFocusableComponent

        public Component findNextFocusableComponent​(int direction)
        Finds the next component to take focus.

        The method returns the next focusable component in a given direction from the component that currently has focus. If the next focusable component is not specified, the closest sibling component in the given direction is returned.

        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the focus moving direction. The value can be one of the following: FOCUS_SIDE_LEFT, FOCUS_SIDE_TOP, FOCUS_SIDE_RIGHT, FOCUS_SIDE_BOTTOM,FOCUS_NEXT, or FOCUS_PREVIOUS.
        Returns:
        Returns the next component to receive focus, or null if no such component can be found.
        Since:
        4

      • findRequestNextFocus

        public boolean findRequestNextFocus​(int side)
        Finds the next component to gain focus and requests focus for it.

        This method finds the next focusable component in a given direction from the currently focused component. If the next focusable component is not found, the closest sibling component in the given direction will be returned.

        Parameters:
        side - Indicates the focus moving direction. The value can be: FOCUS_SIDE_LEFT, FOCUS_SIDE_TOP, FOCUS_SIDE_RIGHT, FOCUS_SIDE_BOTTOM, FOCUS_NEXT, or FOCUS_PREVIOUS.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the component or one of its child components has gained focus; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setUserNextFocus

        public void setUserNextFocus​(int side,
                             int id)
        Sets the next component to give focus to.

        The next component to give focus to must be another child of the same parent. Otherwise, a null pointer will be obtained when findNextFocusableComponent(int) is called.

        Parameters:
        side - Indicates the focus moving direction. The value can be one of the following: FOCUS_SIDE_LEFT, FOCUS_SIDE_TOP, FOCUS_SIDE_RIGHT, FOCUS_SIDE_BOTTOM,FOCUS_NEXT, or FOCUS_PREVIOUS.
        id - Indicates the ID of the next component to give focus to.

      • getUserNextFocus

        public int getUserNextFocus​(int side)
        Obtains the ID of the next component to give focus to.
        Parameters:
        side - Indicates the focus moving direction. The value can be one of the following: FOCUS_SIDE_LEFT, FOCUS_SIDE_TOP, FOCUS_SIDE_RIGHT, FOCUS_SIDE_BOTTOM,FOCUS_NEXT, or FOCUS_PREVIOUS.
        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the next component to give focus to; returns -1 if no such component is set.

      • enableScrollBar

        public void enableScrollBar​(int direction,
                            boolean enabled)
        Sets whether to enable the scroll bar for this component.
        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates the scroll direction, either AXIS_X for horizontal scroll or AXIS_Y for vertical scroll.
        enabled - Specifies whether the scroll bar is enabled. The value true indicates the scroll bar is enabled, and the value false (default value) indicates the opposite case.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        isScrollBarOn(int), (boolean)

      • isRtl

        public boolean isRtl​()
        Checks whether the component is laid out from right to left.

        By default, a component is laid out from left to right and from top to bottom.

        Returns:

        Sets whether to enable the central scroll mode to always display a component item at the center of a component.
        Parameters:
        centralMode - Specifies whether to enable the central scroll mode. The default value falseindicates that the central scroll mode will be disabled, and the value true indicates enabled.
        Since:

        Since:

      • setMode

        public void setMode​(int mode)
        Sets the showing mode of this component.

        When the parameter value is INHERITED_MODE (default value), the parent component's showing mode is used. When the parameter value is RECT_MODE, the content of this component is displayed in a rectangle. When the parameter value is OVAL_MODE, the content of this component is displayed in an ellipse.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the showing mode of this component.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        getMode(), getModeResolved()

      • getMode

        public int getMode​()
        Obtains the showing mode of this component.
        Returns:
        the showing mode. One of the values: INHERITED_MODE, RECT_MODE, OVAL_MODE
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        setMode(int), getModeResolved()

      • getModeResolved

        public int getModeResolved​()
        Obtains the display mode of the device holding this component.
        Returns:
        Returns the display mode, either RECT_MODE or OVAL_MODE.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        setMode(int), getMode()

      • setCenterZoomFactor

        public void setCenterZoomFactor​(float scaleX,
                                float scaleY)
        Sets the zoom factor for scaling the center component item.

        The value can be DEFAULT_SCALE, greater than 1, less than 1, representing the default zoom factor, zoom-out factor, and zoom-in factor respectively.

        Parameters:
        scaleX - Indicates the zoom factor for scaling the center component item on X-axis.
        scaleY - Indicates the zoom factor for scaling the center component item on Y-axis.
        Since:
        3

      • getCenterZoomFactor

        public float[] getCenterZoomFactor​()
        Obtains the zoom factor for scaling the center component item.
        Returns:
        Returns the array of the X-axis and Y-axis coordinates of the zoom factor.
        Since:
        3
